document_data.name: The Glitter Gala - Glittering Baldur's Gate for Over Twenty Years
document_data.author: [[Omotola]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''The Glitter Gala - Glittering Baldur's Gate for Over Twenty Years''''' was a self-promotional material published by [[The Glitter Gala]] shop of [[Baldur's Gate]], penned in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Contents:
The pamphlet featured images of [[patriar]]s of the Gate wearing jewelry designed by Madame [[Omotola]]. The main-stage drawing was 
detailed design of a lavish [[enchanted]] wedding ring created for Lady [[Fireliia Jannath]] of the [[Jannath (family)|Jannath]] patriar family.
document_data.History: ''The Glitter Gala - Glittering Baldur's Gate for Over Twenty Years'' was published in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, soon after Omotola designed the ring for Lady Jannath's wedding to the renowned painter [[Oskar Fevras]]. The ring created by The Glitter Gala was called ''[[Til Death Do Us Part]]''.
